species.description: Apex predator that competes with Brown Bears for elk calves during winter months, and its territory overlaps with Mountain Lions leading to conflicts over mule deer. It displaces Black Bears from prime fishing spots during spawning season, and both species target the same small rodents, creating competition pressure.
species.diet: Large ungulates, small mammals, fish during spawning runs
species.region: Alaska, Western Canada, Northern Rocky Mountains, Great Lakes region

species.habitat: Forests, alpine meadows, coastal areas, tundra
species.description: Omnivore that competes with Gray Wolves for deer carcasses during winter months, and territory overlaps with Grizzly Bears leading to conflicts over prime salmon pools. It displaces Black Bears from berry patches during late summer, and both species target the same small mammals, creating competition pressure.
species.region: Alaska, Western Canada, Northwestern United States

species.description: Stealth predator that competes with Gray Wolves for elk calves during winter months, and its territory overlaps with Bobcats leading to conflicts over mule deer fawns. It displaces Coyotes from denning sites during breeding season, and both species target the same deer fawns, creating competition pressure.

It displaces Coyotes from freshwater springs during drought conditions, and both species target the same small rodents, creating competition pressure.

species.region: Southern United States, Central and South America

species.description: Large reptile that competes with River Otters for fish in prime fishing spots, and territory overlaps with American Beavers leading to conflicts over marsh grasses. It displaces Mallard Ducks from nesting territories during breeding season, and both species target the same small mammals, creating competition pressure.

species.region: North America from Alaska to Central America

species.description: Small predator that competes with Coyotes for rodents during spring harvest, and territory overlaps with Fishers leading to conflicts over rabbit prey. It displaces American Martens from brushlands during breeding season, and both species target the same squirrels, creating competition pressure.

Specialist predator that competes with Bobcats for snowshoe hares during winter months, and territory overlaps with Coyotes leading to conflicts over small mammals. It displaces Fishers from den sites in forests, and both species target the same hares, creating competition pressure.

species.description: Adaptable predator that competes with Lynx for rabbits during winter, and territory overlaps with Coyotes leading to conflicts over rodent prey. It displaces Fishers from brushy areas in spring, and both species target the same rabbits, creating competition pressure.
species.region: North America from southern Canada to Mexico
